Investment Strategy

Powering the AI Revolution ⚡

A detailed breakdown of our investment strategy targeting the power infrastructure super-cycle—the ultimate "picks and shovels" play for the AI age.

Our High-Level Strategy & Rationale

The core investment thesis is that the AI revolution's exponential demand for computation is colliding with the physical, linear, and capital-intensive reality of global energy infrastructure. The true, long-term, and most formidable limiting factor for AI is not silicon, but power. This creates a durable, multi-decade investment opportunity for investors with a 7- to 10-year investment horizon.

  • Exponential Demand Shock: The energy intensity of AI workloads is orders of magnitude greater than traditional computing, creating a structural chasm between digital demand and physical supply.
  • Physical Infrastructure Bottleneck: This demand surge is colliding with a U.S. electric grid that is aging, underinvested, and ill-equipped for the coming load growth, creating a "Time-to-Power" crisis.

Timelines & Execution

Deployment (Years 1-3): Focus on "On-Site Power" solutions that bypass immediate grid constraints, while building foundational positions in grid modernization and new generation leaders.

Maturation (Years 4-10): Capture value from the long-duration grid modernization cycle and the commissioning of new, large-scale power generation assets required to meet sustained AI-driven demand.

The Three Modalities of Power: A Sequenced Strategy

Grid Modernization

The "Highways"

Foundational "picks and shovels." Upgrading and expanding the aging electrical grid with essential hardware like transformers and switchgear. A durable, multi-decade replacement and expansion cycle.

New Generation

The "Power Plants"

Building and operating new utility-scale power generation. Captures value directly from the incremental electricity sold to the AI economy through regulated utilities and independent power producers.

On-Site Power

The "Bypass Lane"

Fast, disruptive "behind-the-meter" solutions like fuel cells and microgrids that solve the immediate "Time-to-Power" crisis for data centers, bypassing multi-year grid connection queues.

Suggested Asset Allocation

Investment Ticker Category Target Allocation
Bloom Energy NYSE:BE On-Site Power (Catalyst) 30% - 40%
Eaton Corporation NYSE:ETN Grid Modernization (Core) 30% - 35%
NextEra Energy NYSE:NEE New Generation (Core) 30% - 35%

Note: Allocation bands provide flexibility. The total portfolio allocation should sum to 100%.

Prime Investment Candidates

Grid Modernization

Eaton (ETN)

A foundational "picks and shovels" provider for the entire AI power build-out and electrification megatrends.

Investment Thesis:

A direct and essential beneficiary of the grid modernization super-cycle. Eaton's vast portfolio of mission-critical electrical hardware, deep engineering expertise, and massive backlog for data center projects provide exceptional visibility into a multi-year growth trajectory driven by non-discretionary infrastructure spending.

New Generation

NextEra Energy (NEE)

A unique combination of a best-in-class regulated utility and the world's largest renewable energy developer.

Investment Thesis:

The premier investment in new power generation. NEE combines the stability of its Florida utility with a world-leading renewable platform (NEER) perfectly positioned to meet massive demand from hyperscalers for clean power. This provides a visible, durable runway for growth, backed by a best-in-class management team and strong financial track record.

On-Site Power

Bloom Energy (BE)

A high-growth enabler solving the most acute near-term pain point for the AI industry: the multi-year wait for grid power.

Investment Thesis:

Bloom's fuel cells solve the critical "Time-to-Power" problem. Its ability to deploy systems in months, versus years for grid connection, provides a powerful value proposition. The recent $5B partnership with Brookfield to power new AI data centers serves as a massive validation of its technology and business model, de-risking the case and providing a clear path to substantial growth.

Predicted Performance Scenarios

Select a market scenario to view illustrative year-on-year performance for each asset, based on the underlying investment thesis.

The Bear Scenario: 25% Probability ("AI Efficiency Breakthrough")

Assumptions:Unexpected breakthroughs in AI chip efficiency (performance-per-watt) and algorithmic optimization dramatically reduce the energy intensity of AI. Growth in AI workloads is largely offset by these powerful efficiency gains, leading to a plateau in data center energy demand. Demand for new generation and grid expansion falls short of forecasts, and the "Time-to-Power" gap narrows, reducing the premium for on-site solutions.

The Neutral Scenario: 50% Probability ("Constrained Growth")

Assumptions:The AI build-out continues at a strong pace but is materially constrained by the physical realities of grid expansion and permitting delays. On-site power thrives in the near-term by solving the "Time-to-Power" gap, while the grid modernization and new generation build-out proceeds at a steady, multi-decade pace. This represents the most likely path, with strong, durable growth across all three modalities.

The Bull Scenario: 25% Probability ("Productivity Supercycle")

Assumptions:AI is deployed at scale across multiple industries, driving a widespread productivity boom. Demand for compute power continues to grow exponentially, and efficiency gains fail to keep pace. Power becomes the undisputed primary bottleneck for economic growth, driving an emergency-level acceleration in energy infrastructure build-out and a significant re-rating of valuations across the sector.

Navigating the Headwinds: Key Risks

AI Efficiency Breakthrough

A non-linear improvement in AI model or hardware efficiency could drastically reduce energy consumption per unit of compute, causing long-term power demand to plateau or decline and potentially leading to an overbuild of infrastructure.

Hyperscaler CapEx Slowdown

A sharp economic downturn or a failure to successfully monetize AI at scale could lead major tech companies to slash their data center capital expenditures, abruptly reducing the primary demand driver for new power infrastructure.

Permitting & Siting Gridlock

Widespread public opposition ("NIMBYism") and slow-moving regulatory approvals could prevent the timely construction of essential new transmission lines and power plants, creating insurmountable bottlenecks for the entire ecosystem.

Sustained High Interest Rates

A "higher for longer" interest rate environment significantly increases the cost of capital for these highly capital-intensive projects, which could compress project returns, slow the pace of investment, and negatively impact valuations.
